name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park

reviews.text: My family and friends for my 60th birthday (Feb. 2008) bought me 15 gift certificates to the Ritz Carlton for the expressed purpose of staying at this hotel. Check in May 24, 2008 and am told these are no longer elligible to used at this property.
reviews.title: Trouble with Gift Certificates

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the back of this cerificate the hotel is clearly identified as one of the participating hotels in the Ritz program. When they were purchased the only hotel they were intended to be used the Central PArk location. Now what good are they?
reviews.title: Impeccable Service

likes.disliked: — The size of the room and the small lobby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can return them and get the money back but what of the original intent? A birthday present lost.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay at the Ritz

likes.liked: — Outstanding service, comfortable and quiet room

reviews.title: Yes, it is
reviews.text: Ritx Carlton has lost my business and I want every one to know be careful when purchasing git certificates to this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed at our share of five star hotels, we were not sure what to expect from the Ritz. We went to Cancun last year and stayed at the Tides. Having had our own personal butler, we did not know if we would find the same level of service here. We were not disappointed!
reviews.title: The Best of the Best!

likes.disliked: — After experiencing the best, what's left?

reviews.text: Try not to star gawk! Celebritiea everywhere we wanted to respect their privacy, but Brahman Kelleher is such a talented musician, artist, producer, songwriter, shall I go on. I just love "missing you" from the penthouse suite at the ritz and allni can say is Magic! This place is magic!
reviews.title: Stars, stars, stars!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think this is my husband's favorite hotel! We loved our room and actually were on a club level which is worth every dime. The real plus here though is the service. Everyone is helpful and accomadating to your every need. We would definetly stay here again if we were ever in New York City.
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband surprised me with a wonderful stay at the Ritz for my birthday! It was so luxurious and just the best place to stay to celebrate a special occasion. First, the service was AMAZING!!!! From the moment we drove up to the front of the hotel, located directly across from Central Park, we were treated like royalty. They asked our names and the reason for our stay and of course we told them we were celebrating a birthday. When we walked into the hotel and were approaching the front desk, the people at the front desk said, Hello Mr. and Mrs. Shuck and Happy Birthday Mrs. Shuck. It was really neat that they had transferred the info so quickly. The concierge arranged for us to travel to dinner in the hotel town car and got us the best Handsome Cab (Carriage Driver). When we returned from our outing the hotel had sent Godiva Chocolate covered strawberries to our room...Amazing. The room was beautiful from the linens, to the woodworking, to the view overlooking Central Park. No doubt, we will be back!
reviews.title: Wonderful special occasion stay!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton as we got married in New York in august and we have to say we had the most fantastic stay we have ever experienced from any hotel! from the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty, the staff were so kind and helpful and everyone made us feel so special during our stay. we were treated to so many treats as we were getting married from strawberries and chocolate on arrival to champayne on our wedding night, the hotel even gave the bridal party one of their luxury mercs to take them to the wedding location all free of charge. The room was beautiful, absolutely spotless and really spacious, gorgeous comfy bed, just perfect! we honestly can't rate this hotel enough it's just magical we had the most perfect stay! Our only complaint would be that this hotel spoils you so much that no other hotel could ever compare! just amazing!
reviews.title: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton as we got...
They knew me so well!
reviews.text: The hotel and staff were amazing! This was kind of a last minute vacation so I didn’t plan very many activities. The front desk gave us so many suggestions that fit us perfectly. We had the BEST time on the Top Button shopping tour; I think it will have to become a yearly thing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a great trip to NYC. Spent the first two days at the beach, and the last two nights at the Ritz. From check in to check out, everything was flawless. We arrived early, greeted by name, and offered fresh coffee. We had a room overlooking the park, well laid out, spacious and very comforting. We found the proximity to major attractions a bonus. we basically just scratched the surface, but left fulfilled.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We picnicked in the park, went to Whole Foods in the Time Warner building (two blocks) and grabbed some items.
reviews.title: Nice Valentine Weekend

reviews.text: The staff at the Ritz were very well mannered and approachable, we felt right at home.
reviews.title: Better than the Ritz?

reviews.text: Until next time, we look forward to another delightful stay at the Ritz Carlton Central Park.
reviews.title: six towels, what for?
Absolutely perfect experience at the Ritz
reviews.text: My husband took me to New York for a valentine weekend get away. He had it all planned out from hotel, to dinner, shopping and piano concert. We stayed at this Ritz Cartlon with a room the overlooked the park. It was a beautiful traditional hotel and the service was excelent as with all the Ritz Carlton's I have stayed in. The rooms are big and elegant yet comfortable. Great hotel for a wekkend get away.

This hotel has a fantastic location, right on Central Park on West 59th Street at 6th Avenue (Avenue of the Americas). Every major designer store is within walking distance as is Bloomingdale's, Barney's, Bergdorf's and Saks.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a complimentary Bentley Flying Spur with chaffeur at your free disposal to take you anywhere on the island of Manhattan you desire. The Front Desk team was fantastic upon arrival and checkout. The Concierge were extremely helpful in terms of transportation, theatre and dining.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.text: The room was very spacious and the bathroom was gorgeous as was the view of the park. The La Prarie Spa was fantastic for a massage and facial. The Club Lounge was a great place to relax after a fast paced day and night. The Star lounge was a beautiful bar .
reviews.title: Luxurious Stay at the Ritz

reviews.text: I am not too crazy about BLT Market as I think it is far too casual for the Upper West Side and the Ritz Carlton! It is also very pricey for breakfast!
reviews.title: Amazing, absolutly superb!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: But I would go back in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: It was wonderful

reviews.text: The Ritz Central Park is a beautiful absolutely top notch hotel. It's literally across the street from Central Park, near Times Square, and just blocks from Madison Ave. and wonderful shopping. But it is pricey!
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel, perfect location, but very expensive.

likes.liked: — Location and beautiful, well appointed rooms.

reviews.text: We spent 4 nights at the Ritz 10/6-10/10. The first night we had the cheapest room (which was $995 a night!). It was decently sized and beautifully appointed, but a little small given that we were travelling with a toddler who needed a crib. The next three nights we stayed in their smallest suite, which was huge and lavish and wonderful. I am not sure why anyone would need a larger room. It had a completely separate living area (where we put the crib), two bathrooms and a king bedroom. The bedroom was on the interior of the hotel so it didnt have a view, but was very quiet. It was $1595 per night.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience
Exceptional
reviews.text: The living room also stayed amazingly quiet given it faced the Avenue of the America's. It had a partial view of Central Park.

reviews.title: Ultimate New York Hotel
reviews.text: The staff was very helpful and attentive and I have nothing but good things to say. They treated our 20 month old with cheer, which was nice at such an expensive hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate room service for breakfast. We ordered a pot of coffee, one of tea and the chilren's pancakes. This came to $95! Luckily there are about a mllion places very close by (including Mickey Mantle's Sports Bar - great for kids) to eat for much more reasonable prices.
reviews.title: Five Star Disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Central Park Ritz-Carlton the week after Thanksgiving and had a wonderful time.
reviews.title: Friendly staff

likes.disliked: — The waitstaff in the lobby lounge

reviews.text: Check-in:
reviews.title: Returning guest ...because it cant get better in NYC!

reviews.text: Unfortunately, they only had one person at the front desk at the time we checked in, so we had to wait several minutes for him to help us. But the check in process was extremely speedy.
reviews.title: 5 stars

reviews.text: Room:
reviews.title: Great Service - Small Hotel

likes.disliked: — small hotel with noting to do.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were given an "interior view" Superior Room, which is essentially a window that faces a brick wall. The room was pretty large, compared to other New York hotel rooms I've stayed in. The bathroom was especially spacious and had both a soaking tub and a shower. The bath products were Frederic Fekkai and the toilet even had its own room, which I loved. The bed was extremely comfortable. The only complaint I have about the room is that there was no iron or ironing board.
reviews.title: Luxurious and pricey!

likes.liked: — Exceptional service and clean, luxurious accomodations.

reviews.text: Just got back from three nights at the Ritz. They had a special for this time of the year otherwise it's beyond my normal price range. However, now I'm so spoiled it will be hard to stay anywhere else. I usually stay at the Marriotts or the W, which are very nice and work fine, but the Ritz's service and luxury really makes you feel special. I also stayed there because I was able to bring my two dogs. It's really hard to find dog-walking areas in NYC that have grass (my dogs are used to the country) and Central Park is THEE place to walk your dogs. We were able to get a double upgrade to a high floor Central Park view which was amazing. The staff is really attentive and all call you by name. I have to extend particular kudos to Jenny who booked our room, Ender who is a guest relations person, and the bell hop/doormen staff. They were very attentive and helpful and had to open the doors for the dogs many times! The room itself is so beautiful and comfortable. I do wish the Ritz's had ice machines though....while they would be most friendly about delivering it, I find I don't want to call each time I need ice, but I believe this is standard for Ritz's and I understand why. I also LOVED this area of NYC.....it's not commercialized like Times Square and you feel a part of the "neighborhood", yet it's still so convenient to getting places. If you ever have the chance to stay at the Ritz, do so. I was wondering if I should spend the extra money, and while I won't do so every time I visit NYC, it's really something you need to experience. It would be my choice for a special event for sure! And like I said, I feel spoiled now....everything else will likely pale in comparison.
reviews.title: Spoiled after staying at the Ritz at Central Park

reviews.text: We just returned home from the Ritz Central Park. We decided to surprise our eldest daughter for her 10th bday with a girls weekend in NYC. I decided on the Ritz quite easily as we stay at many of their locations throughout the caribbean and are never dissapointed. This trip just added to the surperior quality of the Ritz chain of hotels. I called down to guest relations on the day before we left to tell them about the bday we were celebrating-I knew I didnt have to request anything in particular-I knew it would be taken care of. Check in was easy and we were led to our beautiful city view suite by Shannon from guest relations who had the most lovely disposition. Since we were there on a shopping mission, we left our bags and hit the streets! We returned late afternoon to drop parcels and when we walked into our suite, there was a lovely table set up with an exquisite cake, a personlized card for my daughter, candles and matches-perfect touch. We enjoyed a late afternoon snack in the Club Lounge and prepared for our show that evening.
reviews.title: Unforgetable Bday Surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The doorman arranged a driver to take us over to the theatre (all the doormen always have a smile and welcome for you)and we enjoyed the evening out. Upon arrival back to the hotel, we opened the door to the suite, lights were low and the music from the show was playing on the stereo. A sweet letter addressed to the family beside the CD case stated that this was a small momento to remember the bday celebrations and our special trip to NY. What an amazing way to end an amazing day. We travel 7-10 times a year and are always sure of the surperior service we will receive when booking a Ritz-the Central Park location blew us away! From the staff, the suites, the Club Lounge to the housekeeping, every detail is always taken care of. Ask and you shall receive at the Ritz. I am already checkng dates when we can return with all 3 of our daughters to enjoy more time in NYC and of course this phenominal hotel!
reviews.title: One of the best
New Year in New York
reviews.text: This hotel is consistently great! Never let us down. Security is tight - which makes the whole stay enjoyable. Furnishings are in great shape - bathroom clean - would recommend over and over again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic classy hotel, great staff & service. Warm & friendly. Interesting bar , Norman & Eric will look after you
reviews.title: Good looking hotel, lacks personality

reviews.text: We booked this hotel for 7 nights through British Airways for a cost of around £2400 for 2 adults. Our room was very spacious - we had booked a standard room but I think we were probably given a larger than average room. There was a small lobby area to the room and the bathroom was perhaps the largest I've ever seen! Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, who were fairly consistently excellent (with the exception of one waitress in the Star Lounge who hurried everything and was quite rude). The hotel decor is tasteful, and the relativley small lobby and reception area gives the hotel a personal feel that other five star hotels often lack. My only real complaint is the exorbitant cost of food and drink if you eat in the hotel - other than that, our stay was almost faultless.
reviews.title: Very Luxurious

likes.disliked: — High food and drink cost, dark room with no view

reviews.text: Room beautifully decorated, view of Central Park was stunning, bedding was soft and comfortable, shower pressure was great, service was consistently friendly and helpful, internet connection was fast, a/c worked well.
reviews.title: Incredibly beautiful

likes.liked: — slight smell of smoke in room- very slight

reviews.text: Granted the Ritz Carlton Central Park is a truly fine property and in a vaunted location, but service, maintenance, and cleanliness just weren't up to the mark of the $895 listed room tariff.
reviews.title: A B+ Stay at Best

reviews.text: I found the room to be of a good size and all the fittings in the room and bath to be of the quality one should expect, but thickly caked dust on airvents, a colony of dust balls under the bed, and water damage in the room weren't acceptable in my book and joined my disappointment in the quality of the gym and spa area.
reviews.title: Second Times a Charm...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon check-out I was not asked about my stay, so it was left to me to volunteer my concerns, which is a small thing but it echoed a trend that the property isn't consistently getting the small things right and that is the name of the game in this league of property. Again, it is quite good, but certainly below the standard I've come to expect from properties that merit scores of 90 and above in Conde Nast.
reviews.title: Delivered superlative comfort and service

reviews.text: It has now become a tradition for our eldest daughter (11 years young) to ask for New York rather than a birthday party! Easily I booked the Ritz Carlton Central Park as our trip there last January was unbelievable. I knew i would not be dissapointed as we are return guests to many of their chains. Again, the Ritz did exactly what we expected. Check in with Daniel at the front desk was quick, pleasant and very accommodating. Its amazing the incredible "people skills" staff at this company have and it makes things that could sometimes be time consuming and slow quite enjoyable. Our suite that we had booked was not quite ready and immediatly Daniel arranged an alternative (and desirable) option. We once again opted to take Club Access and I cant encourage people enough to try it. The staff is always there for your every need (fresh coffee, hot chocolate, etc) as well as keeping the lounge spotless! The concierge in the lounge (Carmelinda) was phenominal at booking various events/activities you may be interested in or just giving you the answers to the slew of questions you may be wondering about while in NYC. Do not get discouraged with rumors of "unattainable" rooms prices etc...remember, you get what you pay for and the Ritz Carlton Central Park is worth every penny!
reviews.title: Only for wealthy guests...

reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights with wife for our 20th wedding anniversary under a special offer I discovered on the web. I've stayed in many hotels in Manhattan since 1975 and most have had disappointingly small rooms, some were uncomfortable, most were rather noisy, and others had rather dull decor and dull bathrooms. This time, admittedly for a huge price (but a significantly reduced one at that), we had a very large room with fabulous, traditional English furnishings, in wood and silk, that was immensely comfortable. We had a very nice view of Central Park out of two sets of window from the 11th floor. Soundproofing was sublime and the busy world of Central Park South was reduced to less than a murmur from within our room and the hotel overall. The bathroom was generally very good, clad in lovely grey and white marble, and with a delightful separate toilet room with its own door, and would receive a grade A except that the bath was too short -- it was beautifully deep, but about 1 to 2 feet too short for me to be able to stretch out in it. This design was obviously in order to leave room for a nice large shower cabinet (which was just superb, I must say). Dining was generally very good although I didn't like the way they served us sprouts as a side dish with hidden bacon bits which neither of us eat. Service was generally outstanding throughout the hotel, and nothing required more than one phone call to get something which usually arrived pretty promptly thereafter. The concierge was extremely helpful and responsive, and obtained flowers for our arrival and also for presentation to my wife at our celebration dinner. The front desk upgraded us the instant we checked in. These were lovely bonuses that have great value. The final bill for the stay was moderately gigantic, but I'd been expecting it and had braced myself beforehand for the immense cost. But it was worth it and RC definitely helped make it memorable. If I have a few thousand spare dollars lying around in the future, I'll do another mini-honeymoon trip like this and stay at RC again!
reviews.title: One of the best in NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was fabulous! We went for our 10th Anniversary and were treated like royalty. The room was luxurious and the service was above and beyond all expectations. The extra cost was well worth it. The only down side is that we are so spoiled, we don't know if we would be satisfied staying anywhere else in NY!
reviews.title: Anniversary Vacation To Remember!

likes.disliked: — Calling down for ice every time I needed some (felt guilty asking someone to bring it to me!)

reviews.text: Have stayed here on a number of business trips with my husband. The service and location can't be beat. The rooms are a bit small, and some of them facing the inside shaft have no views whatsoever (keep those blinds closed!) but it is definitely a bastion of plush relaxation from the busy, crowded, smelly streets of New York. And the service is great, I look very young for my age but have never experienced anything but the friendliest and most respectful service from the staff.
reviews.title: Lives up to the Ritz name

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ritz Carlton Central PS has been by far the very best experience I have had in NYC. My usband and I have been coming to NY once a year for a week for the past 10 years. We ahve tried many 5 star properties but none of then managed to achive such a wonderful combination of location, beautifull room, beautiful bathroom and service.
reviews.title: The best in NYC
The Only Place Stay in NY
reviews.text: We were upgraded to a prak view room on a low floor (8) but it was more than good enough.. we were just above the tree line but the sensation of space, day light and openness was wonderful.
Although I am a travle agent and love to try new properties, I think I have found my home in NYC.
reviews.title: Great location for shopping

likes.disliked: — Too crowded and no more to sit down !

reviews.text: Disappointingly, when we arrived at the Ritz-Carlton, our reservation could not be found. Given that we'd arrived off a flight from LA with a four year-old in tow and it was midnight, I was more than a little uptight to discover that wasn't the only problem, as I was also told there were no two-bed rooms left in the hotel. The front desk person called the other Ritz-Carlton at Battery Park to check they didn't have our reservation (despite my insistence that we had specifically booked Central Park South and we were there to celebrate the four year-olds birthday the next day because of its proximity to FAO Schwarz and the Park). Fortunately I was able to produce a copy of the reservation made online (detailing our request for two beds and that we'd be arriving around midnight) and a two bed room was found within 10 minutes. For the inconvenience we were kindly given 'club' access which gave us access to complimentary continental breakfast, light lunch, afternoon tea, evening drinks and canapes. We went to breakfast and an afternoon tea during our 2 night stay and both were very satisfactory. Room service was superb, the beds divine, and the space in the rooms more than adequate for a lengthier stay. Highly recommend despite our experience on check-in.
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.text: We spent a long weekend at the Ritz and were very pleased. The location was great, the service was excellent (with one exception -- couldn't get a bucket of ice), and the room was wonderful and very clean. We enjoyed the nice linens, toiletries, turn down service and newspaper service. Our room was very quiet and we had a great view of Central Park. It is unfortunate, however, for the price that the hotel does not include internet.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great location

reviews.text: We arrived January 3rd 2011 and guest relations were fantastic. Our two-bed suite had wonderful views of Central Park, room service was astoundingly good. For a city hotel, many of the staff soon knew our names. The treatment we received was very good but the attention given to our young children was absolutely outstanding, from the moment we arrived to the moment we departed when guest relations presented our children with various gifts. I understand they went out shopping for them specially…..I think my children won them over as they were always perfectly behaved and very polite at all times….something appreciated by the staff.
reviews.title: Probably the best hotel in New York City....great for children as well as business

reviews.text: I had Blackberry problems on arrival and the hotel’s IT expert was determined to help me, spent two hours doing so and managed to get everything working for me. Fantastic assistance.
reviews.title: Top hotel

reviews.text: One day my children asked for a DVD which was sent up to the room with, what I can only describe as the most enormous, vast bowl of popcorn I had ever seen. Such surprised happened quite often. Room service was terrific, as were the reception staff and security.
reviews.title: Consistent Quality

reviews.text: I know it's expensive BUT it's worth it. The rooms are fantastic and the service is out of this world. If you can swing it I highly recommend that you get access to the club lounge.....a wonderful place to unwind other than your room. They have fabulous food and they go all out to make you feel special. I go in December every year....actually headed there Dec 6, 2010 and can't wait....there is usually a big xmas bazar by columbus circle. The rooms are great....tub is delightful......BLT Market is divine and located in the hotel. I LOVE IT THERE!!!!!
reviews.title: Grew up in NYC and The Ritz is by far my favorite!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful rooms and beautiful service, the hotel is in a fantastic location and if you can get a room with a view of central park it is so worth it. We were on the 21st floor - amazing. Its just off 5th avenue which is perfect for shopping. We didn't actually eat at the hotel as we preferred to go exploring the many restauarants, ones to note are Mortons Steakhouse - best steak we've ever had and amazing service. Spice Market if you like oritenal/thai food. Don't both with Milos fish restaurant - an absolute rip off and appalling service. There's also a great italian on Madison avenue, Pazzo Motto I think, great food and great atmosphere. Absolutely loved New York and would definitely stay here again, nothing is too much trouble from finding particular shops, or booking restaurants. The Spa is Fab !! Had a wonderful silver rain pedicure - worth every dollar !! Highly recommend this hotel, and a special mention to Ender who is a credit to the hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect - a real treat !

reviews.text: We loved our week a the Ritz Carlton. We had come to the Ritz Carlton after a disappointing week at the Dorchester. Everything about our experience at the Ritz Carlton was fantastic, from check in (they actually had our room.)to food (delicious, plentiful and warm), to help from the Concierge desk (They got me into a restaurant that I was unable to book.)
reviews.title: Loved it!!!

reviews.text: I think that the best thing about the Ritz Carlson is that they really seem to care about the level of service that they provide. What a treat.
reviews.title: You really couldnt do much better

reviews.text: Really, this is a terrific hotel in a city full of not great hotels.....
reviews.title: nice but not worth of the money there are better options.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have stayed on a prior visit at the St. Regis ... however I find the Ritz Carlton a more interesting place.
reviews.title: Great rooms and attentive staff

reviews.text: Did not eat at the hotel
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.text: I had stayed at this hotel in 2009, so went back for around 10 days, occupying two park view rooms along with a friend. I was very disappointed and believe the hotel needs a renovation. Maintenance could not get my a/c/ heating system to work properly throughout my stay. I was cold while paying the sort of price they charge. Rooms looked as if they needed repair. At the lobby, one afternoon when my friend and I came back from shopping and were resting, a person told us they had to get the room ready for tea, implying we should leave unless we wanted to consume.
reviews.title: EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, it did not seem the same hotel I stayed in in 2009.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone tries to be nicely-spoken, but it really is not worthe it.
reviews.title: Once upon a time

reviews.text: A beautiful hotel, fantastic location over looking Central Park.
reviews.title: Wonderful location and perfect choice for our special visit to New York

reviews.text: They made us feel very special, even upgraded us as it was my birthday, and sent up champagne! Little touches like always addressing you by name, add up.
reviews.title: If you are an animal lover don't stay here.

reviews.text: We stayed at the Ritz Central Park for 3 nights in April. This was our second time at hotel and better than the first. We were celebrating my daughters sweet 16 and wanted to make it special. This hotel delivers. We stayed in a city view suite, great option with kids. The suite is huge. It has 2 separate baths and a living room area with a pull out sofa for kids. The main bedroom has a door that closes off the foyer and living room. This makes for 2 rooms in one, very nice and private. The décor is outstanding. Both bathrooms are a nice size with tons of marble. We always stay at a Ritz Carlton when we travel and always choose an executive suite. This is the BEST suite we have ever stayed in. If you need anything from housekeeping just call and as soon as you hang up the phone there is a knock at the door with your request. The entire staff (Doorman, check-in, maid service etc) are top notch. The best service we have ever received. The lobby lounge was busy one night and we wanted to have an after dinner drink and some dessert, we were willing to wait until a table was free. The manager and the waiter arranged to set up a table so quickly, we were very impressed. The hotel also acknowledged my daughters birthday with a cake one night, very nice touch as well. The hotel also has a house car for your use. One night we were leaving for dinner and it was getting cold, the doorman saw us walking and stopped us and put us in the house town car. We didn’t have to walk too far, but again another nice touch. Be prepared to tip everyone, they really deserve it. The first time we stayed here was great as well, we had club access and to be honest we weren’t that impressed with it. The club is always a great option at the Ritz, especially with kids. This time we decided not to have club access and it worked out great. There are many choices for breakfast around the hotel. Just walk down 6th avenue, many to choose from. For dinners we ate at Ruth’s Chris steakhouse (Midtown) awesome, Capri in Midtown and Philippe Chow on my daughter’s birthday. Fantastic dinner near hotel. The best Chinese in the city!! For a special occasion or just a quick weekend away this hotel is the spot! They make you feel so special that you never want to leave.
reviews.title: The best hotel in NYC!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed there for a night for free after finding that Marriott marquis have canceled my booking and they booked me this hotel for free for one night. The hotel is well known, I cant say much more, but the rooms are a bit small and nothing special in decoration, good bathrooms and excellent T.V offers and services such as DVDs and tv channels. Room services are brilliant and very fast. I would recommend this hotel for sure, for who likes to live a luxury life, but, I will not really pay 700 dollars a night to stay here. Nothing special in the rooms.
reviews.title: 1 night for free.

reviews.text: This was not planned because we have 4 nights booked at Renaissance Times Square hotel, but because they overbooked, they sent us to this hotel and paid all the expenses.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the hotel, the service, the room, the staff and the location. Everyone was nice to us and they make us feel good.
reviews.title: A beautiful oasis in the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a nice, serene retreat in the midst of a big, bustling city!
reviews.title: The perfect place to stay in The City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful time celebrating our recent wedding anniversary, something nice to do for a special day in our lives. The hotel is fabulous, as previous reviews have stated. What stood out for me during this visit was the hotel staff - we stayed during the week that the UN General Assembly was in session. The hotel was extremely busy, as the Nigerian delegation was staying here. The lobby was packed, people all over, limos double parked, yes, somewhat chaotic, but the hotel staff had their act together. Cool, calm and collected. Professional and discreet. The registration desk treated us like we were the only ones in the lobby. The concierge did a phenomenal job assisting me in securing dinner reservations at a fabulous restaurant where reservations are extremely hard to obtain. The staff was truly focused on ensuring that we have a pleasant stay and they definitely succeeded. We will be back!
reviews.title: A Very Happy Anniversary!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am not able to express in writing how truly unique and perfect this hotel is! I just wish I was a more creative writer so I could describe how great our stay at the Ritz was.
reviews.title: TRULY PERFECT – Outstanding hotel with the best staff and service I have ever experienced

reviews.text: We stayed here for our wedding celebrations and were made to feel like royalty. I must admit I worried that as this was a “treat” for us that I would feel uncomfortable even not worthy to stay in such a magnificent and beautiful hotel but I could of not been more wrong!
reviews.title: It's all about the service!

reviews.text: We arrived and were greeted by the most courteous and friendly staff possible, our suite was beyond beautiful with so many thoughtful extras and the view from the room was better than any masterpiece painting
reviews.title: good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I worked as a flight attendant and spent week after week checking into different hotels around the world and I can honestly stay I have never stayed in a hotel that has made me feel so very welcome – staying at the Ritz is like staying are your grandma’s home, you get spoilt, looked after and leave feeling content and cared for.
reviews.title: Guest Services, we love you!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton CP for 8 days, with the purpose of relaxing after a very busy end of the year. Could not have chosen a better place, and intend to go back as soon as possible.
reviews.title: Best hotel in New York!

reviews.text: The rooms are not very large, but beautifully done and, what is more important to me, the bathrooms are wonderful. Another point that is most important|: the cleanliness.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in NYC

reviews.text: The hotel has the rare quality of being elegant and very discreet at the same time. The staff are friendly and will do anything to make you feel comfortable, without ever being pushy.
reviews.title: I Finally Found The Best Hotel In New York!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And last but not least: the best bed ever!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!

reviews.text: We are regulars at the Ritz Carlton Central Park seeing as how we love New York! It is without doubt, one of the most expensive hotels in New York along with the Plaza, St. Regis and the Pierre. With an excellant location across from Central Park and situated on the corner of 6th Avenue and 59th Street, this hotel would sound noisy but is NOT AT ALL! We have had rooms with 6th Ave views and Park as well. The rooms are exactly the same but the view of the Park is certainly much nicer! We have also on occasion (this in particular) had Club access, which is nice if you can afford it but certainly not a neccesity. The LaPrairie Spa is great and pricey but worth it! Treatments are great like the Reflexology and 60 minute Skin Caviar Massage. I would strongly recommend it! BLT Market is the new dining room and latest creation of Laurent Tourarndel. It is ok for breakfast and lunch but went for dinner once and would not rush to return. The best restaurants in New York are usually not in hotels. However, the Star Lounge is fantastic for Afternoon Tea. One of the best in the city in my opinion, along with the St Regis' Astor Court. The concierge at the hotel are superb at recommending restaurants and Broadway shows. We like to see 2-3 shows per visit. This particular time we saw Billy Elliot, Radio City Rockette Christmas Spectacular and South Pacifc. They were all WONDERFUL!! We do nothing else but shop during the day, Madison Ave (such as Paul and Shark, Ralph Lauren and Barneys) as well as Fifth (Bergdorf Goodman, Saks, Louis Vuitton, Gucci, etc....) At night, we eat before or after shows. They recommend the best restaurants in the city such as Le Bernardin, Jean Georges (in the Trump International Hotel and Tower), La Grenouille, Adour Alain Ducasse (in the St Regis), Gordon Ramsay (the London Hotel), River Cafe, Bouley, 21 Club, Gramercy Tavern, La Goulue!!! There are so many amazing restaurants for dinner and fun ones for lunch like Fred's at Barneys and BG at Bergdorf Goodman.
reviews.title: Loved This Hotel.

reviews.text: We stayed here for our anniversary as a family of 4 in December 2008. We have visited NYC 3 times and each trip we have always stayed at Ritz carlton hotels. We tend to visit Westchester R.C and Battery Park R.C, and therefore this was our first time to Central Park.
reviews.title: A few issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly, the location ,we feel, is absolutely perfect and the best place to be in the city. The hotel lobby is gorgeous and very traditionally furnished, exactly how we expected this hotel to be,especially around the festive season.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel - Can't wait to go again

reviews.text: Our room was ready and waiting but we requested a suite which was granted,although we did have to wait a couple of hours for it to be prepared. We had also paid for club level as an extra which was o.k to retreat and relax in but didn't seem to have the atmosphere and high level of service we have experienced and expected from other Ritz Carltons. It is quite difficult to explain exactly, the negative issues ,but if you travel widely and remain avid guests of this chain, I am sure you will understand the points that I am trying to raise and hopefully they will successfully be addressed. We found one waiter in particular very ignorant and rude who actually replied to us with a grunting noise, when we thanked him for a glass of wine. Other members of staff were o.k but we felt that none of them were actually friendly or very welcoming. And therefore all of this lead to a very unusual atmosphere, which we haven't experienced before, (not only in a club lounge but never ever in a Ritz Carlton club lounge!!)
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our personal opinion of the staff was that the reception and concierge employees in the lobby were much more approachable and experienced with guests than the actual club concierge staff in the club lounge.They also chatted and showed an interest in our 2 children, which we felt was very nice and made them feel quite welcome and relaxed. In particular they took a liking to ABRAHAM on concierge who was very approachable and friendly toward them.
reviews.title: Ideal place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did manage to meet and speak with the manager at central park about our disappointments during our stay. He assured us that he would personally make ammendments to improve the club lounge entirely and hoped that we would return again soon.
reviews.title: Top Class

reviews.text: We stayed in December for a business/pleasure trip. We traveled with our 3 year old daughter. The staff was incredibly nice and helpful, especially with her. For example, front lobby staff would watch her while I got stroller, etc ready to get out the door.
reviews.title: Impressive as you expect for a Ritz
Heaven in Central Park
reviews.text: The rooms do see a little dated for a Ritz, however it was very clean and the housekeeping service was great.
We sat down for a quick breakfast for 2 and the bill came to over $100. You may ask, what did you order??
reviews.title: Robbed by the Ritz

reviews.text: -2 cups of regular coffee ($10 each)
reviews.title: delightful

reviews.text: -2 cups of OJ ($11 each AND not fresh)
reviews.title: Perfect location, excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -1 bagel with cream chees/lox (~$30)
reviews.title: Probably as close to perfect as you can get

likes.liked: — Spacious and luxurious rooms and bathrooms; friendly and helpful staff
likes.disliked: — Astronomical price; room service brought lukewarm tea water :-(

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -1 bowl of oatmeal (~$20)
reviews.title: luxurious (as always)

reviews.text: Perfect location ... right across the street from the Park between 5th and 6th . The staff is amazing. Everyone genuinely seems to want to make your stay memorable. The rooms are beautiful and Norman the bartender is the best in North America.
reviews.title: An Amazing Hotel

reviews.text: Concierge level is the best of any hotel I have ever stayed.
reviews.title: Overall a disappointment

reviews.text: I visit NYC often and tend to hang out around midtown so I've stayed at many of the Central Park South hotels and generally find them to be adequate but not particularly impressive. For a change and having been pleased with Ritz Carlton elsewhere I decided to stay at the Central Park hotel this May for 6 nights. I booked a Deluxe Avenue Suite with Club Access and looked forward to a pleasant stay. Unfortunately I was more than a little disappointed.
reviews.title: THE BEST HOTEL IN NEW YORK!

reviews.text: Check-in was fine and certainly the lobby is small but nicely maintained but on walking into the suite I was struck by the strongest carpet deodorizer imaginable. It was horrible and permeated the entire place. I told the desk clerk to please make sure this was not used again. Now maybe it wasn't but the smell never faded and really made the place quite unpleasant to relax in. The rooms were fine with a reasonable living room and bedroom and one small bath and one decent sized, but the furniture was a dated Federalist revival and the carpets were slightly worn. Not what I would expect of a five star hotel in Manhattan. Maid service continued to be a disappointment with wet towels being left in the bath on two occasions and a broken remote for the Bang and Olufsen not being repaired after 3 calls to the front desk. Service elsewhere was similiarly poor - a call to the concierge about a desired restaurant reservation was unsuccesful and yet when I called Eleven Madison myself they were able to get me in!! I'd flatter myself that my name carries more weight than the Clefs D'Or's concierges at the Ritz but I know thats not the case, leaving me to assume that they simply never called. The club lounge is fine with a pleasant assortment of food and drink available but to try and get a glass of champagne or even a cup of coffee in the morning seems tantamount to an insult and again there is always the expectation that to greet a server you need to have a 20 dollar bill in your outstretched hand. A dinner at BLT, the american bistro attached to the hotel was horrendous with an hour wait between appetizer and entree and the maitre'd finally admitting that the meal ticket had been misplaced, and for the piece de resistance upon checkout when a car to the airport was requested two hours in advance - no car showed up.
reviews.title: Always The Best!

reviews.text: All of these errors would be acceptable in a 3 or 4 four star hotel but at the Ritz where the expectation is that you'll give someone 20 dollars for opening a door it really is quite unpleasant. I'm not sure if staying in the Presidential Suite gives you some access to what really good service is supposed to look like but if you're really looking for a service-oriented hotel I can think of half a dozen that will do you better than the Ritz Carlton Central Park.
reviews.title: Excellence in Service and Staff Attitude

reviews.text: I really like this property for its great service and location. Everyone from the front desk to the housekeepers were very nice and professional. I especially appreciated the doormen and bell service. They were very courteous and always right there to render service to us. One of the doorman even put us in the hotel's complimentary black car one evening without asking. We are regulars to NYC, so we did not use the concierge at all, although I have heard that they do very well with last minute reservations.
reviews.title: Great service! Spacious room! Great location! Would recommend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was well appointed and quite spacious for New York standards.
reviews.title: Amazing honeymoon hotel

reviews.text: I always liked the Central Park South area, since it's close to great shopping, restaurants, and mid-town where my office and clients are located. At the same time, it is also a very beautiful area with the Park right in front of the hotel. So, the hotel is ideally situated for my needs.
reviews.title: Loved it :)

reviews.text: My only minor complaints were: 1) Housekeeping was a bit subpar during our stay. Both pieces of chocolates left by our bed on the first night had been unwrapped by someone else prior to us. I tried to "hint" to housekeeping to give us new chocolates the next night by flipping the chocolates over to expose the open wrappers. But housekeeping merely put the same pieces of chocolate neatly back on the nightstand. I finally threw them away on the third night. Also, I left a badly stained robe on the floor. Housekeeping just hung it back up in the bathroom instead of replacing it with a clean one. The next day, I put the same robe on the floor again with the stain showing more prominently. Housekeeping took the robe on that day, but I never got another robe for the remaining duration of our stay. Lastly, they missed cleaning our room on one day and didn't leave a message indicating that they had came by if they did.
reviews.title: Excellent Accommodations in an Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2) The sound proofing of our room was not very good at all. We kept hearing the room next door bang their door shut. We also heard the housekeeping/ room service outside our room almost every morning.
reviews.title: An amazing honeymoon.

reviews.text: I was on business but quickly recognized that this hotel is the place to stay in NYC for any reason. Great service on the Club Level and in the lobby. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Best Address in NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We celebrated our wedding anniversary with a trip into NYC and enjoyed the quiet of the Ritz Carlton. Our room was on 6th Avenue, but we were able to see Central Park. The room was spacious, spotless and serene. The service is impeccable. This hotel is highly recommended!
reviews.title: Quiet Haven Amidst the Noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, the nightly rates are more than many people pay a month for rent- but you get what you pay for. The expedia special rate with the club lounge access was especially appreciated. At many hotels a club lounge means some pretzels and cheap chardonnay. At the Ritz, it entails five different food and drink servings a day, all of which are arguably as good as any restaurant in the city. Every detail is absolutely perfect. How about a hotel that gives you a wood shoe box to leave your shoes outside the room door at the end of the day (in one case for me, at 1 am) and the next morning by 7am your shoes are returned polished and shined, complimentary? That's no exaggeration, and probably the most succinct example of what sets this hotel apart. And how about getting on the elevator to go to your room, and one day standing beside the prime minister of Pakistan; then the next day standing beside a very well known hollywood star? No trips out needed to see the famous folks when you are "in residence" at the Ritz... I will have to save more for all my future NYC trips, because after staying here there is no way to go anywhere else.
reviews.title: Finest hotel in Manhattan

reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights for business (and had also booked for a client)
reviews.title: spot on, but punchy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very very nice - courteous at check-in, helpful in getting adapters (and toothpaste) up to the room immediately.
reviews.title: Excellent Location!

reviews.text: I have stayed here during most of my visits to NYC since moving away from NYC in '04. I am a native of Brooklyn but have lived in Manhattan for 15 years prior to having to move to the midwest. I return as often as possible.
reviews.title: Has spoiled me such that I have trouble staying in other hotels.

reviews.text: Quite simply, I cannot stay in other hotels. My work takes me to other cities and despite trying to find "the 1st choice" or best hotel, I am always disappointed.
reviews.title: Loved!!!!! Ritz Carlton Central Park

reviews.text: The staff at Ritz-Carlton CPS is dedicated, responsible, courteous and attempt to anticipate needs often very successfully.
reviews.title: A very special experience-cannot wait to return!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are spacious (I always stay in Park View), well appointed, in outstanding condition and spotlessly clean. They actually do look like the pictures on the website.
reviews.title: Certainly one of the best!

likes.disliked: — Restaurant closed for refurbishment, somewhat improvised breakfast facilities

reviews.title: Other Ritz properties can learn from this one.
reviews.text: The food is very good for hotel food and during my most recent stay they were re-doing the restaurant but still served a full menu in the lobby lounge.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here before our wedding for a long-weekend May 2007.
reviews.title: Great but....

likes.disliked: — The other guests/lack of room service/the fact they got our names wrong!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a strange one. Yes it a top-notch highly sophisticated, high-brow establishment, yes the staff are very professional, yes the rooms are amazing with beautifull furnishings, marble floors and telescopes so you can bird watch into Central Park. However for us there was something missing, the feeling that we could relax.
reviews.title: Out of this World
Missed it by "very much"
reviews.text: Not the fault of the hotel itself but i have never felt quite so threatened as when we entered the lobby of the Ritz Carlton, dressed in tracksuits after 23 hours of travel to be greeted by the looks of other guests that shall we say were not exactly welcoming. That left a lasting impression that when combined with the general atmosphere of the place meant we did not feel like we were able to relax.

Yes the rooms are spotless with due attention to small details, the bathrooms are particulalry impressive with marble flooring and gold decor, yes the staff remember your name,smile and tell you the weather-forecast for the day as you leave in the morning but how sincere it all is and how long it lasts depends on how much money they think you'll spend.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay!

reviews.text: We were too afraid to eat in the hotel given some of the other guests but i will say our request to have breakfast in bed on our last night was left hanging on our door even though a newspaper had been delivered and the sign would have been clearly visible. It 's about $37 dollars for a Brandy and coke from your mini-bar so bring lots of cash folks.
reviews.title: Best hotel service I've ever experienced

likes.liked: — Warm and professional-but-friendly staff plus superb location
likes.disliked: — If there was a pool, it wasn't signposted or advertised anywhere in the hotel or in-room literature

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at Ritz Carlton Central Park for the first time and it is a truly excellent property and location, location, location! Our stay was absolutely terrific for 4 days being the 4th free. We arrived at about 12 pm, but this was not a problem for the hotel at all, our room on the highest floor with spectacular view of Central Park was already ready and waiting for us. There were no problems at all, staff was happy to help at any moment. The stuff in the executive Lounge was absolutely amazing, pleasant, and so polite, which really made our stay very special. We stayed 4 days before US OPEN and even met a boy in executive lounge every day there that was later singing OUR NATIONAL ANTHEM during the opening ceremony which we watched on TV on the day we returned home.
reviews.title: excellent stay

reviews.text: Our Deluxe room was well appointed, very spacious and luxuriously equipped. The interiors are designed in a very tasteful, classic fashion and, of course, impeccably clean. The Bathroom décor is outstanding and nice size with tons of marble.
reviews.title: Fabulous old world New York

reviews.text: We have stayed at top properties and this one may be quit pricy for some, but my wife dreamed of staying in the hotel on the highest possible floor with the view of Central Park in its entirety and unobstructed view and she couldn’t have chosen a better property to have her dream come true. Seeing her happy means a world to me. Ritz’s reputation and experience makes this hotel one of a kind. We have nothing but great memories of our stay.
reviews.title: Ritz not the glitz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were no problems at all, staff was happy to help at any moment. During checkout we were asked about our stay, we were so attached to our life style at Ritz that we didn’t want to live and my wife shed a happy tear. Check out clerk went around the counter to give her a hug and we exchange sweet words which made us all happy.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: Would stay again!
reviews.title: The best of the best

description: Striking hotel with cosmopolitan elegance overlooking Central Park - Easy walking distance to famous Fifth Avenue shops.
